intro: Melothria abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian sour fig, is a climbing shrub native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant produces small, yellowish-green fruits that are typically covered in a fine, white down. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are slender and often hairy. The plant is adapted to arid environments and thrives in regions with warm, dry climates.
